titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. John McNichols, Transcript
CWG6077

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Scott Circuit Court
"The Commonwealth of Kentucky to the Sheriff of Fayette County,

You are commanded to summon John McNichols & James Moran to appear in the Scott Circuit Court on the first day of its next November Term to show cause why Judgement should not be rendered against them for $400 dollars, on account of the forfeiture of the bail bond executed by them for the appearance of John McClosky in said Court, for Murder; and have then and there this writ, with due return how you have executed it, Given under my hand as clerk this 24 day of June 1864"

"J W Holloway clk
"By Geo E West D C"
"Executed within summons this 14th day of October 1864 By delivering a true copy of within Summons to John McNichols Jas Moran not found in my county"

"W C Houghton D S
"For W W Dowden S. F. C."
At a court held for the circuit of Scott at the court house in Georgetown on the 21st day of Novr. (First Day of Term) 1864 The following Judgts was rendered, viz:

Commonwealth of Ky Plaintiff
against (1X Indict (No 276) Forfeited Recog
John McNichols & James Moran Defendants

The defendant John McNichols having been duly summoned and failing to answer and the court advised It is ordered and adjudged that the plaintiff recover of said defendant the sum of Four hundred dollars with interest thereon at the rate of six per centum per annum from the 21 day of November 1864 until paid & his costs herein expended
Ordered that alias process issue herein to Bourbon County against the defendant James Moran & Cause is continued as to him
And on the first day of December following an execution issued ^to Fayette County^ on the foregoing Judgement, in words & figures as follows to-wit:

"The Commonwealth of Kentucky
To the sheriff of Fayette County, Greeting

We command you that of the estate of John Mc'Nichol, late of your bailiwick, you cause to be made the sum of Four Hundred Dollars, which the Commonwealth of Kentucky late in our Scott Circuit Court hath recovered against him for debt, with interest thereon at the rate of six per cent per annum from the 21st day of November 1864 until paid; also, the sum of $435, which
"to the said Commonwealth of Kentucky in said court were adjudged for her costs in that suit expended, whereof sd. McNichol is convicted, as appears to us of record; and that you have the same before said court on the 30th day of in January next, to render to the said Commonwealth of Ky., the debt, interest & costs aforesaid; and have them and there this writ
Witness John W Holloway clerk of Said Court this 1st day of December 1864, and in the 73d year of the Commonwealth"

"Jno W Holloway clk
"By J C Lemon D C"
True copies of summons & shff's return on Forfeited Bail Bond -- Judgment and execution,

Decr 7th 1864
attest J C Lemon D C

Scott Cir. Ct
Comth Ky
vs } sums on Forft Bail Bond Judgt & Extn
John McNichols

A true copy
att J C Lemon Dc
